001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers;
002
003import java.math.BigInteger;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.Comparator;
006
007public final class RationalBigIntegerSupport implements JavaNumberTypeSupport<Rational<BigInteger>> {
008
009    private static final Rational<BigInteger> ONE = new Rational<>(BigInteger.ONE, BigInteger.ONE);
010    private static final Rational<BigInteger> MINUS_ONE = new Rational<>(BigInteger.valueOf(-1), BigInteger.ONE);
011    private static final Rational<BigInteger> ZERO = new Rational<>(BigInteger.ZERO, BigInteger.ONE);
012
013    protected RationalBigIntegerSupport() {
014    }
015
016    @Override
017    public String name() {
018        return "Rational with BigInteger";
019    }
020
021    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
022    @Override
023    public Rational<BigInteger>[] createArray(int length) {
024        Rational<BigInteger>[] array = (Rational<BigInteger>[]) new Rational<?>[length];
025        Arrays.fill(array, ZERO);
026        return array;
027    }
028
029    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
030    @Override
031    public Rational<BigInteger>[][] createArrayOfArrays(int rows, int columns) {
032        Rational<BigInteger>[][] rationals = (Rational<BigInteger>[][]) new Rational<?>[rows][columns];
033        for (Rational<BigInteger>[] array : rationals) {
034            Arrays.fill(array, ZERO);
035        }
036        return rationals;
037    }
038
039    @Override
040    public Rational<BigInteger> multiply(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
041        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(second.numerator()),
042                first.denominator().multiply(second.denominator()));
043    }
044
045    @Override
046    public Rational<BigInteger> divide(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
047        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()),
048                first.denominator().multiply(second.numerator()));
049    }
050
051    @Override
052    public Rational<BigInteger> add(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
053        if (first.denominator().equals(second.denominator())) {
054            return rational(first.numerator().add(second.numerator()), first.denominator());
055        }
056        if (first.denominator().mod(second.denominator()).equals(BigInteger.ZERO)) {
057            BigInteger factor = first.denominator().divide(second.denominator());
058            return rational(first.numerator().add(second.numerator().multiply(factor)), first.denominator());
059        }
060        if (second.denominator().mod(first.denominator()).equals(BigInteger.ZERO)) {
061            BigInteger factor = second.denominator().divide(first.denominator());
062            return rational(first.numerator().multiply(factor).add(second.numerator()), second.denominator());
063        }
064        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()).add(second.numerator().multiply(first.denominator())), first.denominator().multiply(second.denominator()));
065    }
066
067    private Rational<BigInteger> rational(BigInteger numerator, BigInteger denominator) {
068        if (numerator.equals(denominator)) {
069            return ONE;
070        }
071        BigInteger gcd = gcd(numerator, denominator);
072        if (gcd.compareTo(BigInteger.ONE) > 0) {
073            numerator = numerator.divide(gcd);
074            denominator = denominator.divide(gcd);
075        }
076        return new Rational<>(numerator, denominator);
077    }
078
079    private static BigInteger gcd(BigInteger a, BigInteger b) {
080        a = a.abs();
081        b = b.abs();
082        while (b.compareTo(BigInteger.ZERO) != 0) {
083            BigInteger temp = b;
084            b = a.mod(b);
085            a = temp;
086        }
087        return a;
088    }
089
090    @Override
091    public Rational<BigInteger> minusOne() {
092        return MINUS_ONE;
093    }
094
095    @Override
096    public Rational<BigInteger> one() {
097        return ONE;
098    }
099
100    @Override
101    public Rational<BigInteger> zero() {
102        return ZERO;
103    }
104
105    @Override
106    public boolean equals(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
107        return first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()).compareTo(first.denominator().multiply(second.numerator())) == 0;
108    }
109
110    @Override
111    public boolean greaterThan(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
112        return first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()).compareTo(first.denominator().multiply(second.numerator())) > 0;
113    }
114
115    @Override
116    public Rational<BigInteger> squareRoot(Rational<BigInteger> value) {
117        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
118    }
119
120    @Override
121    public Rational<BigInteger> valueOf(double value) {
122        if (!Double.isFinite(value)) {
123            throw new IllegalArgumentException("NaN/Infinity not supported");
124        }
125        if (value == 0.0) return ZERO;
126        value = Math.round(value * 1000) / 1000.0;
127        String s = Double.toString(value);
128
129        // Handle scientific notation by converting to plain string
130        if (s.contains("E") || s.contains("e")) {
131            s = new java.math.BigDecimal(s).toPlainString();
132        }
133
134        int pos = s.indexOf('.');
135        int numerator;
136        int denominator;
137
138        if (pos == -1) {
139            // No decimal point
140            numerator = Integer.parseInt(s);
141            denominator = 1;
142        } else {
143            int digitsAfter = s.length() - pos - 1;
144            String digits = s.substring(0, pos) + s.substring(pos + 1);
145
146            numerator = Integer.parseInt(digits);
147            denominator = (int) Math.pow(10, digitsAfter);
148        }
149
150        return numerator == denominator ? ONE : rational(BigInteger.valueOf(numerator), BigInteger.valueOf(denominator));
151    }
152
153    @Override
154    public Comparator<Rational<BigInteger>> comparator() {
155        return (o1, o2) -> greaterThan(o1, o2) ? 1 : greaterThan(o2, o1) ? -1 : 0;
156    }
157}
